00055 #ifdef Q_OS_WIN
00056 void setRTPriority()
00057 {
00058     Log() << "Setting process to realtime";
00059     if ( !SetPriorityClass(GetCurrentProcess(), REALTIME_PRIORITY_CLASS) ) 
00060         Error() << "SetPriorityClass() call failed: " << (int)GetLastError();    
00061 }
00062 double getTime()
00063 {
00064     static __int64 freq = 0;
00065     static __int64 t0 = 0;
00066     __int64 ct;
00067 
00068     if (!freq) {
00069         QueryPerformanceFrequency((LARGE_INTEGER *)&freq);
00070     }
00071     QueryPerformanceCounter((LARGE_INTEGER *)&ct);   // reads the current time (in system units)
00072     if (!t0) t0 = ct;
00073     return double(ct-t0) / double(freq);
00074 }
00076 void setProcessAffinityMask(unsigned mask)
00077 {
00078     if (!SetProcessAffinityMask(GetCurrentProcess(), mask)) {
00079         Error() << "Error from Win32 API when setting process affinity mask: " << GetLastError();
00080     } else {
00081         Log() << "Process affinity mask set to: " << QString().sprintf("0x%x",mask);
00082     }
00083 }
00084 #elif defined(Q_OS_LINUX)
00085 void setRTPriority()
00086 {
00087     if (geteuid() == 0) {
00088         Log() << "Running as root, setting priority to realtime";
00089         if ( mlockall(MCL_CURRENT|MCL_FUTURE) ) {
00090             int e = errno;
00091             Error() <<  "Error from mlockall(): " <<  strerror(e);
00092         }
00093         struct sched_param p;
00094         p.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_max(SCHED_RR);
00095         if ( sched_setscheduler(0, SCHED_RR, &p) ) {
00096             int e = errno;
00097             Error() << "Error from sched_setscheduler(): " <<  strerror(e);
00098         }
00099     } else {
00100         Warning() << "Not running as root, cannot set priority to realtime";
00101     }    
00102 }
00103 
00104 double getTime()
00105 {
00106         static double t0 = -9999.;
00107         struct timespec ts;
00108         clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC, &ts);
00109         double t = double(ts.tv_sec) + double(ts.tv_nsec)/1e9;
00110         if (t0 < 0.) t0 = t; 
00111         return t-t0;
00112 }
00113 
00115 void setProcessAffinityMask(unsigned mask)
00116 {
00117     cpu_set_t cpuset;
00118     CPU_ZERO(&cpuset);
00119     for (unsigned i = 0; i < sizeof(mask)*8; ++i) {
00120         if (mask & 1<<i) CPU_SET(i, &cpuset);
00121     }
00122     int err = sched_setaffinity(0, sizeof(cpuset), &cpuset);
00123     if (err) {
00124         Error() << "sched_setaffinity(" << QString().sprintf("0x%x",mask) << ") error: " << strerror(errno);
00125     } else {
00126         Log() << "Process affinity mask set to: " << QString().sprintf("0x%x",mask);
00127     }
00128 }
00129 #else /* !WIN and !LINUX */
00130 void setRTPriority()
00131 {
00132     Warning() << "Cannot set realtime priority -- unknown platform!";
00133 }
00135 void setProcessAffinityMask(unsigned mask)
00136 {
00137     Warning() << "`Set process affinity mask' for this platform unimplemented -- ignoring.";
00138 }

00140 #include <QTime>
00141 namespace Util {
00142 double getTime()
00143 {
00144     static QTime t;
00145     static bool started = false;
00146     if (!started) { t.start(); started = true; }
00147     return double(t.elapsed())/1000.0;
00148 }

00152 static const GLubyte *strChr(const GLubyte * str, GLubyte ch)
00153 {
00154     while (str && *str && *str != ch) ++str;
00155     return str;
00156 }
00157 
00158 static const char *gl_error_str(GLenum err)
00159 {
00160     static char unkbuf[64];
00161     switch(err) {
00162     case GL_INVALID_OPERATION:
00163         return "Invalid Operation";
00164     case GL_INVALID_ENUM:
00165         return "Invalid Enum";
00166     case GL_NO_ERROR:
00167         return "No Error";
00168     case GL_INVALID_VALUE:
00169         return "Invalid Value";
00170     case GL_OUT_OF_MEMORY:
00171         return "Out of Memory";
00172     case GL_STACK_OVERFLOW:
00173         return "Stack Overflow";
00174     case GL_STACK_UNDERFLOW:
00175         return "Stack Underflow";
00176     default:
00177         qsnprintf(unkbuf, sizeof(unkbuf), "UNKNOWN: %d", (int)err);
00178         return unkbuf;
00179     }
00180     return 0; // not reached
00181 }
00182 
00183 bool hasExt(const char *ext_name)
00184 {
00185     static const GLubyte * ext_str = 0;
00186 #ifdef Q_WS_X11
00187     static const char *glx_exts = 0;
00188     if (stimApp() && stimApp()->glWin()) stimApp()->glWin()->makeCurrent();
00189 #endif
00190     static const GLubyte space = static_cast<GLubyte>(' ');
00191     if (!ext_str) 
00192         ext_str = glGetString(GL_EXTENSIONS);
00193     if (!ext_str) {
00194         Warning() << "Argh! Could not get GL_EXTENSIONS! (" << gl_error_str(glGetError()) << ")";
00195     } else {
00196         const GLubyte *cur, *prev, *s1;
00197         const char *s2;
00198         // loop through all space-delimited strings..
00199         for (prev = ext_str, cur = strChr(prev+1, space); *prev; prev = cur+1, cur = strChr(prev, space)) {
00200             // compare strings
00201             for (s1 = prev, s2 = ext_name; *s1 && *s2 && *s1 == *s2 && s1 < cur; ++s1, ++s2)
00202                 ;
00203             if (*s1 == *s2 || (!*s2 && *s1 == space)) return true; // voila! found it!
00204         }
00205     }
00206 
00207 #ifdef Q_WS_X11
00208     if (!glx_exts) {
00209      // nope.. not a standard gl extension.. try glx_exts
00210      Display *dis;
00211      int screen;
00212 
00213      dis = XOpenDisplay((char *)0);
00214      if (dis) {
00215          screen = DefaultScreen(dis);
00216          const char * glx_exts_tmp = glXQueryExtensionsString(dis, screen);
00217          if (glx_exts_tmp)
00218              glx_exts = strdup(glx_exts_tmp);
00219          XCloseDisplay(dis);
00220      }
00221     }
00222      if (glx_exts) {
00223          const char *prev, *cur, *s1, *s2; 
00224          const char space = ' ';
00225          // loop through all space-delimited strings..
00226          for (prev = glx_exts, cur = strchr(prev+1, space); *prev; prev = cur+1, cur = strchr(prev, space)) {
00227         // compare strings
00228              for (s1 = prev, s2 = ext_name; *s1 && *s2 && *s1 == *s2 && s1 < cur; ++s1, ++s2)
00229             ;
00230              if (*s1 == *s2 ||  (!*s2 && *s1 == space)) return true; // voila! found it!
00231          }
00232      }
00233 #endif
00234     return false;
00235 }

00237 #ifdef Q_WS_X11
00238 void setVSyncMode()
00239 {
00240     if (hasExt("GLX_SGI_swap_control")) {
00241         Log() << "Found `swap_control' GLX-extension, turning on \"wait for vsync\"";
00242         int (*func)(int) = (int (*)(int))glXGetProcAddressARB((const GLubyte *)"glXSwapIntervalSGI");
00243         if (func) {
00244             func(1);
00245         } else
00246             Error() <<  "GLX_SGI_swap_control func not found!";
00247     } else
00248         Warning() << "Missing `swap_control' GLX-extension, cannot enable vsync!";           
00249 }
00250 #elif defined(Q_WS_WIN) /* Windows */
00251 typedef BOOL (APIENTRY *wglswapfn_t)(int);
00252 
00253 void setVSyncMode()
00254 {
00255     stimApp()->glWin()->makeCurrent();
00256     wglswapfn_t wglSwapIntervalEXT = (wglswapfn_t)QGLContext::currentContext()->getProcAddress( "wglSwapIntervalEXT" );
00257     if( wglSwapIntervalEXT ) {
00258         wglSwapIntervalEXT(1);
00259         Log() << "VSync mode enabled using wglSwapIntervalEXT().";
00260     } else {
00261         Warning() << "VSync mode could not be enabled because wglSwapIntervalEXT is missing.";
00262     }
00263 }
00264 #elif defined (Q_WS_MACX)
00265 
00266 void setVSyncMode()
00267 {
00268     stimApp()->glWin()->makeCurrent();
00269     GLint tmp = 1;
00270     AGLContext ctx = aglGetCurrentContext();
00271     if (aglEnable(ctx, AGL_SWAP_INTERVAL) == GL_FALSE)
00272         Warning() << "VSync mode could not be enabled becuse aglEnable AGL_SWAP_INTERVAL returned false!";
00273     else {
00274         if ( aglSetInteger(ctx, AGL_SWAP_INTERVAL, &tmp) == GL_FALSE )
00275             Warning() << "VSync mode could not be enabled because aglSetInteger returned false!";
00276         else
00277             Log() << "VSync mode enabled using aglSetInteger().";
00278     }
00279 }
00280 
00281 #else
00282 #  error Unknown platform, need to implement setVSyncMode()!
00283 #endif

00287 bool hasAccurateHWFrameCount()
00288 {
00289     if (fc_is_accurate < 0)  getHWFrameCount();

00294 unsigned getNProcessors()
00295 {
00296     static int nProcs = 0;
00297     if (!nProcs) {
00298         SYSTEM_INFO si;
00299         GetSystemInfo(&si);
00300         nProcs = si.dwNumberOfProcessors;
00301     }
00302     return nProcs;
00303 }

00336 #ifndef Q_OS_WIN /* GLX */
00337 unsigned getHWFrameCount()
00338 {
00339     static int (*func)(unsigned int *) = 0;
00340     static bool triedToFindFunc = false;
00341     if (!triedToFindFunc && !func) {
00342         triedToFindFunc = true;
00343         stimApp()->glWin()->makeCurrent();
00344         func = (int (*)(unsigned int *))QGLContext::currentContext()->getProcAddress( "glXGetVideoSyncSGI" );
00345         if (!func) {
00346             Error() << "No hw framecount func., will be emulated"; 
00347             fc_is_accurate = 0;
00348         } else
00349             fc_is_accurate = 1;
00350     }
00351     if (func) {
00352         unsigned int ret;
00353         func(&ret);
00354         return ret;
00355     }
00356     // otherwise emulated from the time and the HW refresh count -- note this may be off or drift because the system CPU clock is not necessarily synchronized to the video clock, right?
00357     return static_cast<unsigned>(getTime() * getHWRefreshRate()); 
00358 }
00359 #else /* WINDOWS */
00360 unsigned getHWFrameCount()
00361 {
00362     static BOOL (WINAPI *func)(HDC, INT64 *ust, INT64 *msc, INT64 *sbc) = 0;
00363     static bool triedToFindFunc = false;
00364     if (!triedToFindFunc && !func) {
00365         triedToFindFunc = true;
00366         stimApp()->glWin()->makeCurrent();
00367         func = (BOOL (WINAPI *)(HDC, INT64 *, INT64 *, INT64 *))QGLContext::currentContext()->getProcAddress( "wglGetSyncValuesOML" );
00368         if (!func) {
00369             Error() << "No hw framecount func., will be emulated"; 
00370             fc_is_accurate = 0;
00371         } else
00372             fc_is_accurate = 1;
00373     }
00374     if (func) {
00375         static INT64 f0 = 0;
00376         HDC hdc = wglGetCurrentDC();
00377         INT64 ust, msc, sbc;
00378         func(hdc, &ust, &msc, &sbc);
00379         if (!f0) f0 = msc;
00380         return msc-f0;
00381     }
00382     // otherwise emulated from the time and the HW refresh count -- note this may be off or drift because the system CPU clock is not necessarily synchronized to the video clock, right?
00383     return static_cast<unsigned>(getTime() * getHWRefreshRate()); 
00384 }
00385 #endif
00386 
00387 #ifdef Q_OS_WIN
00388 unsigned getHWRefreshRate() 
00389 { 
00390     unsigned rate = 0;
00391     //if (!rate) {
00392         HDC dc;
00393         bool defaultdc = false;
00394         if (stimApp() && stimApp()->glWin()) {
00395             dc = GetDC(stimApp()->glWin()->winId());
00396         } else {
00397             dc = CreateDCA( "DISPLAY", NULL, NULL, NULL );
00398             defaultdc = true; 
00399         }
00400         if (!dc) {
00401             Error() << "Could not create Win32 DC, getHWRefreshRate() will always return fake value of 120Hz!";
00402             rate = 120;
00403         } else {
00404             rate = GetDeviceCaps(dc, VREFRESH);
00405             //Debug() << "Windows reports HW refresh rate " << rate << "Hz";
00406         }
00407         if (defaultdc) {
00408             DeleteDC(dc);
00409         } else if (dc) {
00410             ReleaseDC(stimApp()->glWin()->winId(), dc);
00411         }
00412         //}
00413     return rate;
00414 }

00417 {

00423 unsigned getHWRefreshRate()
00424 {

00426         return stimApp()->refreshRate();
00427     return 120;
00428 }

00445 void socketNoNagle(int sock)
00446 {
00447     BOOL flag = 1;
00448     int ret = setsockopt(sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, reinterpret_cast<char *>(&flag), sizeof(flag));
00449     if (ret) Error() << "Error turning off nagling for socket " << sock;
00450 }
